wait: This might take a while to process :time_ticking:
welcome:
Welcome to Wikimedia Zulipchat. Here are some resources on getting started:
* [How to contribute](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/How_to_contribute) - learn about different areas where you can get involved.
* A [new developers guide](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/New_Developers) and [How to be a MediaWiki hacker](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/How_to_become_a_MediaWiki_hacker) that cover some basics about Wikimedia's open-source culture.
* [Software projects](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/New_Developers#Choose_a_software_project) that you can look into. The skills required for each project are also mentioned here.
* Some  [good first bugs](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Good_first_bugs) you can start with.* Language-specific Phabricator tasks like [Javascript](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/tag/javascript/), [CSS](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/tag/css/), etc.

You can join the #**technical-support** channel to get technical help related to Wikimedia projects. Feel free to ask any questions on #**general**!
Type `!help` for a full list of available commands.
helptext:
Here's what I can do for you:
Type `!gsod` for help with GSoD proposals.
Type `!gsoc` for help with GSoC proposals.
Type `!outreachy` for help with Outreachy proposals.
Type `!faq 'your question'` to search FAQs.
Type `!wikipedia 'title'` to search articles.
Type `!stackoverflow 'your question'` to search questions.
Type `!projects` to get a list of projects.
Type `!chat mediawiki` to get help regarding MediaWiki software.
Type `!chat wikimedia` to get technical help regarding Wikimedia.
You can also join the #**technical-support** channel to get technical help related to Wikimedia projects.
gsoc:
Here are some links to get you started.
Read the information guide for GSoC participants: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/Participants
Read the project ideas for this year: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/2020
You have been subscribed to the #**gsoc20-outreachy20** stream for further help.
gsod:
Here are some links to get you started.
Read the information guide for GSoD participants: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Season_of_Docs/Participants
Read the project ideas for this year: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Season_of_Docs/2020
You have been subscribed to the #**gsod20** stream for further help.
outreachy:
Here are some links to get you started.
Read the information guide for Outreachy participants: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Outreachy/Participants
Read the project ideas for this year: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Outreachy/Round_20
You have been subscribed to the #**gsoc20-outreachy20** stream for further help.
chathelp:
Please specify your required assistance in the following format:
* `!help chat mediawiki` for assistance with MediaWiki software.
* `!help chat wikimedia` for assistance with technical issues related to Wikimedia projects.
wikimedia:
You can get help at the [#wikimedia-tech](https://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=wikimedia-tech) IRC channel or at [Wikimedia Developer Support](https://discourse-mediawiki.wmflabs.org) on Discourse.
You have been subscribed to the #**technical-support** stream for further help.
mediawiki:
You can get help at the [#mediawiki](https://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=mediawiki) IRC channel or at [Wikimedia Developer Support](https://discourse-mediawiki.wmflabs.org) on Discourse.
You can see a full list of available IRC channels [here](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/IRC/Channels#MediaWiki_and_technical).
You have been subscribed to the #**technical-support** stream for further help.
projectdetails: You can see more details about the project by typing: `!projects <number>`.
